name: importunity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] the quality of repeatedly asking for something, in a forceful and annoying way: With increasing importunity, they demanded political power to match their economic power.
[ C ] a repeated request, made in a forceful and annoying way: I finally took what he offered me to save myself from his importunities. Finally, she rose and opened the door to her sister's importunities.
More examplesFewer examplesAt last, seeing the importunity of her father's expression, she stepped slowly into the room. Some time later, giving in to my importunity, he consented.
